title: givemetroncom
author: givemetroncom
content: https://rubyrewards.com/Hello Bitcointalk ,Welcome to Ruby Rewards, claim the best crypto casino bonuses. Complete exclusive tasks and win more as you win.We boost you to earn increase extra profits by offering you special tasks on the most popular and new casino sites.Complete Casino Tasks and increase your points, free spin every day, rise in the rankings and get free rewards.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: This is a good initiative OP. I like the fact that you took out your time to work on this and coming up with this project. I actually did go through the website and I must say that the website is user friendly and easy to navigate. I had to go through the terms and conditions of service so as to get familiarised with it before further engagement because that is what I normally look out for so as not to have issues with my withdrawal or funds in the nearest future. I checked out for KYC and found nothing about it there and I am curious because your terms and conditions is similar to that of casinos and would want to hear from you with respect to KYC.What is your stand on KYC? Would you conduct KYC for members registered on your platform or your platform does not require KYC? If you would give in to KYC, at what point would it be required for members to do because it is not stated on your terms and conditions of service.

comments.author: givemetroncom
comments.body: Quote from: CryptSafe on December 12, 2023, 05:07:57 PMThis is a good initiative OP. I like the fact that you took out your time to work on this and coming up with this project. I actually did go through the website and I must say that the website is user friendly and easy to navigate. I had to go through the terms and conditions of service so as to get familiarised with it before further engagement because that is what I normally look out for so as not to have issues with my withdrawal or funds in the nearest future. I checked out for KYC and found nothing about it there and I am curious because your terms and conditions is similar to that of casinos and would want to hear from you with respect to KYC.What is your stand on KYC? Would you conduct KYC for members registered on your platform or your platform does not require KYC? If you would give in to KYC, at what point would it be required for members to do because it is not stated on your terms and conditions of service.Hello,No KYC required

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: So let me try and get things straight here. You are like running a promotional campaign, which is for casino sites where users are required to do some particular task in order for them to earn a reward that they can use to place a bet either at any casino of their choice or at any of the casinos they perform the task at. As I can see, anyone who wants to participate will need to have an account with your site first, which is where the task will be allocated to them on a daily basis, and they will complete and report their task back to you. If that's the case, I will see that this is just in the form of a bounty or shilling, and the only connection it has with the gambling section is that you are trying to promote some casinos that are listed or are partnering with you.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Quote from: givemetroncom on December 12, 2023, 05:46:16 PMQuote from: CryptSafe on December 12, 2023, 05:07:57 PMThis is a good initiative OP. I like the fact that you took out your time to work on this and coming up with this project. I actually did go through the website and I must say that the website is user friendly and easy to navigate. I had to go through the terms and conditions of service so as to get familiarised with it before further engagement because that is what I normally look out for so as not to have issues with my withdrawal or funds in the nearest future. I checked out for KYC and found nothing about it there and I am curious because your terms and conditions is similar to that of casinos and would want to hear from you with respect to KYC.What is your stand on KYC? Would you conduct KYC for members registered on your platform or your platform does not require KYC? If you would give in to KYC, at what point would it be required for members to do because it is not stated on your terms and conditions of service.Hello,No KYC requiredIt is obvious that you would say no KYC but when  it dawns on you that the government agencies would come after you, you would begin to demand for members to do KYC as it checked you have no license does ot mean that your services does not require you having a licence because from looks, there are some task of me would need to do which means that you are in one way or the other benefiting from your client tasks as affiliate to the casino and that would require some form of requirements and I believe you that.  Would you tell me that you ignored the licensing or you do not require being licenced?

comments.author: AmoreJaz
comments.body: Quote from: CryptSafe on December 12, 2023, 09:10:01 PMIt is obvious that you would say no KYC but when  it dawns on you that the government agencies would come after you, you would begin to demand for members to do KYC as it checked you have no license does ot mean that your services does not require you having a licence because from looks, there are some task of me would need to do which means that you are in one way or the other benefiting from your client tasks as affiliate to the casino and that would require some form of requirements and I believe you that.  Would you tell me that you ignored the licensing or you do not require being licenced? just wondering, since this is not the casino itself, do they really need to be licensed? they are just third party offering some rewards. i can understand the casino itself can have their license. so it is up to the user if he will avail the rewards and sign up in the casino using their affiliate link. the user himself is responsible for checking the casino itself about the terms and conditions. this third party site is not responsible whether you will submit your kyc to the casino or not. this is why it is on you whether you will sign up in the casino or not, as they are just third party services promoting the casino via their affiliate link. because if you look at their shop also, the vouchers available can only be used on the casinos they are promoting with. so if you are not a player of that casino, how can you redeem such rewards? but it is good that they have alternative offer to spend your coins, which is to withdraw your crypto.@OP, do you still have other casinos that you think you can add to your current list? it is good that you have stake and gamdom already in the list, as most gamblers here are in one way or another familiar to these casinos. so maybe, it won't be hard for you to get some users.

comments.author: goldkingcoiner
comments.body: Quote from: givemetroncom on December 12, 2023, 05:46:16 PMI checked out for KYC and found nothing about it there and I am curious because your terms and conditions is similar to that of casinos and would want to hear from you with respect to KYC.As I understand it their website is not a casino itself and therefore it does not require KYC. That is understandable. The website seems to be an information aggregation website for current bonuses and rewards of casino websites. Did I understand that right? Also, for OP's context: The Bitcointalk community is a bit touchy about KYC because here sometimes new casinos introduce themselves and misrepresent "no KYC" when in truth KYC is required BUT the casino means that they reserve the right to demand KYC at any time for any reason. They just make it sound like there is no KYC (for marketing purposes). I wish new casinos would stop marketing their platform this way. It does not make them look trustworthy and everyone knows that centralized casinos cannot go against the regulations that the government demands of them (without being shut down / suffering heavy fines).

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Quote from: goldkingcoiner on December 12, 2023, 09:45:23 PMQuote from: givemetroncom on December 12, 2023, 05:46:16 PMI checked out for KYC and found nothing about it there and I am curious because your terms and conditions is similar to that of casinos and would want to hear from you with respect to KYC.As I understand it their website is not a casino itself and therefore it does not require KYC. That is understandable. The website seems to be an information aggregation website for current bonuses and rewards of casino websites. Did I understand that right? Also, for OP's context: The Bitcointalk community is a bit touchy about KYC because here sometimes new casinos introduce themselves and misrepresent "no KYC" when in truth KYC is required BUT the casino means that they reserve the right to demand KYC at any time for any reason. They just make it sound like there is no KYC (for marketing purposes). I wish new casinos would stop marketing their platform this way. It does not make them look trustworthy and everyone knows that centralized casinos cannot go against the regulations that the government demands of them (without being shut down / suffering heavy fines).To be truthful, they are not a casino, but they have something to gain from the relationship they share with the casinos listed on their website, and for that reason, their benefits would be much greater in consonant with the traffic they get through their website to the casinos. With respect to the KYC, it is true that members here are very much wary of it because of the casinos irresponsible approach towards that aspect of their terms and conditions.Hence, I would demand to know and be sure to avoid having issues with the casino in the future. Most casinos that exhibit that corny approach ends up  being deserted by members because of their tricks which is very bad of the casinos doing such.

comments.author: lionheart78
comments.body: This is more like a referral site where the task is to get registered under their referral link.  You can see it on their site, giving link in disguise of a bonus reward.  I think the task is good for people who are have not signed up yet to the casino.If you look at the site task page, a member should register or wager an amount under an affiliate link.  That is probably where the site gets its income and the source of the fund for rewards.  There is also this trading page where the points/coins accumulated can be bought or trade to a certain credit of the given casino.I think this is one good site to get extra funds if one is actively engaging on gambling and is yet to register on the given casino platforn stated by the site.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: lionheart78 on December 12, 2023, 10:27:14 PMThis is more like a referral site where the task is to get registered under their referral link.  You can see it on their site, giving link in disguise of a bonus reward.  I think the task is good for people who are have not signed up yet to the casino.If you look at the site task page, a member should register or wager an amount under an affiliate link.  That is probably where the site gets its income and the source of the fund for rewards.  There is also this trading page where the points/coins accumulated can be bought or trade to a certain credit of the given casino.I think this is one good site to get extra funds if one is actively engaging on gambling and is yet to register on the given casino platforn stated by the site.Yes it is an affiliate site for casino platforms it's more like a Get paid to scheme a platform usually offers for CPA sites not unique it is more of a cash-back site, OP did not properly explain what the site is all about, he should get a copper account so he can post images, since he is promoting a platform here.They should explore new casinos so many members are already at Stake.com and they should check the reputation of the casinos they are working with and will work with.

comments.author: Bitinity
comments.body: Quote from: AmoreJaz on December 12, 2023, 09:30:35 PMQuote from: CryptSafe on December 12, 2023, 09:10:01 PMIt is obvious that you would say no KYC but when  it dawns on you that the government agencies would come after you, you would begin to demand for members to do KYC as it checked you have no license does ot mean that your services does not require you having a licence because from looks, there are some task of me would need to do which means that you are in one way or the other benefiting from your client tasks as affiliate to the casino and that would require some form of requirements and I believe you that.  Would you tell me that you ignored the licensing or you do not require being licenced? just wondering, since this is not the casino itself, do they really need to be licensed? they are just third party offering some rewards. i can understand the casino itself can have their license. so it is up to the user if he will avail the rewards and sign up in the casino using their affiliate link. the user himself is responsible for checking the casino itself about the terms and conditions. this third party site is not responsible whether you will submit your kyc to the casino or not. this is why it is on you whether you will sign up in the casino or not, as they are just third party services promoting the casino via their affiliate link. because if you look at their shop also, the vouchers available can only be used on the casinos they are promoting with. so if you are not a player of that casino, how can you redeem such rewards? but it is good that they have alternative offer to spend your coins, which is to withdraw your crypto.Seems that cryptsafe misunderstood about this site, he seems to think that it is a gambling site while in fact it is just an affiliate site. I cant say it is review site since there is no review at all, but it works like review site where the main purpose is to get referrals through the offer provided in the site. Of course will be no KYC asked because I have never seen review site or affiliate site that asked KYC from their members. KYC will be asked in the casinos only as the main service and the one that usually being regulated. I'm not sure if affiliate site is also regulated by license or government but I have never heard such a case before. Quote from: CryptSafe on December 12, 2023, 10:18:49 PMTo be truthful, they are not a casino, but they have something to gain from the relationship they share with the casinos listed on their website, and for that reason, their benefits would be much greater in consonant with the traffic they get through their website to the casinos. With respect to the KYC, it is true that members here are very much wary of it because of the casinos irresponsible approach towards that aspect of their terms and conditions.Hence, I would demand to know and be sure to avoid having issues with the casino in the future. Most casinos that exhibit that corny approach ends up  being deserted by members because of their tricks which is very bad of the casinos doing such.KYC related issue may come in any casino and affiliate site has nothing to do with it. There is no review site or affiliate site which give guarantee that there will be no issue in the future. If an issue happen, we cant blame the affiliate/review site because once we join in a casino through a review/affiliate site, we should be ready for any possible issue that may come in the casino. Unless you are talking about issue for the reward offered by the affiliate site, this one is different case and it is the responsibility of the affiliate site.

comments.author: pakhitheboss
comments.body: Quote from: Bitinity on December 13, 2023, 02:48:24 AMSeems that cryptsafe misunderstood about this site, he seems to think that it is a gambling site while in fact it is just an affiliate site. I cant say it is review site since there is no review at all, but it works like review site where the main purpose is to get referrals through the offer provided in the site. Of course will be no KYC asked because I have never seen review site or affiliate site that asked KYC from their members. KYC will be asked in the casinos only as the main service and the one that usually being regulated. I'm not sure if affiliate site is also regulated by license or government but I have never heard such a case before. Indeed it is a casino affiliate website where user needs to register themselves to get task. It is not a casino therefore the question of KYC is out of context here. How are they providing users with tasks to earn is new in the casino affiliate industry. It seems like they are sharing the rewards of affiliates with their users in the form of tasks and each task would require some kind of investment. That is all I can gather from what is written in the OP. They have named only two casinos as those are the two names displayed on their home page, so trust won't be an issue for them.

comments.author: Wind_FURY
comments.body: Quote from: lionheart78 on December 12, 2023, 10:27:14 PMThis is more like a referral site where the task is to get registered under their referral link.  You can see it on their site, giving link in disguise of a bonus reward.  I think the task is good for people who are have not signed up yet to the casino.If you look at the site task page, a member should register or wager an amount under an affiliate link.  That is probably where the site gets its income and the source of the fund for rewards.  There is also this trading page where the points/coins accumulated can be bought or trade to a certain credit of the given casino.I think this is one good site to get extra funds if one is actively engaging on gambling and is yet to register on the given casino platforn stated by the site.Although you're right that the site uses their referral link for new sign ups, I think they're following a model that's probably more like a cash-back site. It's popular among online shoppers because they could collect cash-backs and points, giving them a sort of discount from their online purchases.For playing in casinos, if some of the fees go back to your pocket, then long term it could be considered as a small reduction of house edge.OP, welcome to BitcoinTalk.
